lines.text: They both look at each other. "I'm not familiar with this spice you speak of. My apologies." She's like, "I'm sorry. I do not know this fusaka you speak of."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's pulling our chain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or maybe it's something illicit.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: It's possible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or something that you snort.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's pretty cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I understand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can we leave them a bit of water?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we should leave them some water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog! Water boy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you give them some water from our jug?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where do you keep your personal water?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would you like some water?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got it. Here, take this jug of water with our compliments. You said give them a jug!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where do you store your water in the house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have, around this way--" He leads you towards the back of this small kitchen. It's very condensed. You can see there is a high metal fence, and there appears to be a rainwater receptacle there, like a well that is built into the homestead. It has chains over the top. He begins to pull keys out and lock to it, and as he pulls off the chains one by one, he pulls back the lid, this hard, dry wooden lid, and within it is a very deep well, though it looks like the water level's maybe ten feet down from the top of the well right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want me to pour the Alchemy Jug in here? Or just one of the little ones?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pour the Alchemy. The little one's for us today. The Alchemy Jug, this is where it's going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, I take the Alchemy Jug and I go: You want to see a trick? Look inside. Do you see anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey, Opesa, do you see anything?" And she blinks a bit. "No, it's empty."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I say: Now, give it a listen. And I shake it. What do you hear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nothing. You are a strange man." (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How much water does it create?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It creates eight gallons of fresh water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh wow. "You are still a very strange man, but I'm very happy and appreciative."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am a great sorcerer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. I can see, now. Gilmore has his work cut out for him."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Gedd-e-mo-ray.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pats your shoulder. "Geddmore, indeed." As you finish pouring the water out, they lead you guys back to the front.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What time is it here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pulls out a small sundial from his pocket, holds it up. "It would be closer to late afternoon."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we aren't going to make it to Ank'Harel by dark. Yes, of course. That's all. Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, thank you so much for coming."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beep-beep!

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN, LIAM
lines.text: Be pleased.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be pleased." And they both, in a very rusty joints way, give you both a bow as you leave.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They were a couple of sweethearts.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They are adorable! They're both over 70, so who's going to kill them? Should Grog, or should I?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's our turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You broke him!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You kill one, I'll kill the other.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Throwback Thursday.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is what a d10 is for. Hold on, one second.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have any more reason to be here? Or should we start heading off to Ank'Harel?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we head off to Ank'Harel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, unless we see any kind of potion shops here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can mist us. I brought it today.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh. We can mist.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there enough moisture in the air? I have no idea how it works.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit, if we evaporate, I'll be so pissed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. Can that happen?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't know!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because we're mist.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're mostly water. I think it's our water. I think we end up very dehydrated at the end of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, I just spit all over you. I'm sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's okay. Now I'm moister.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's how mist form works.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now I'm

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think we'd evaporate. I think he's fucking with us. I don't think we'd evaporate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's mist it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They fade into existence!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be the worst thing ever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was that a global warming metaphor?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No songs to be sung. Just fucking another cloud in the fucking sky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think we'll evaporate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to mist it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we need anything else while we're here, before I do this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a one-camel town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mist us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to go one by the other, you do hear a couple of (gasps). You glance over your shoulder to see three kids, all looking up at you all with these big, scared smiles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then I mist.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to Slimer the kid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As I turn into mist, I go: I'm melting! Melting! Oh, what a world!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was trying to inspire them!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're a

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do they speak Common?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After you give your presentation, they, "Whoa!" As you begin transforming, you do that and they go, (terrified screaming) and go running indoors.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm still going to slime them on their way out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sliming them!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're tormenting children.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, that's a step up for us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's what Vox Machina is all about.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scarring children for life.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you can't kill the old, terrify the young.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're leaving them with a promise that we'll be back to finish the job.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are terrible people. You guys rise into the air as the sun begins to bring itself to set in the west. You shift up over the city. You look down. Probably maybe 150, 200 buildings make up the entirety of Shandal. It's not a very large town, but you can see little dots of moving caravans both to and from the city. It is a fairly lively stop for people traveling to and from Ank'Harel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can follow traffic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Follow traffic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a traffic line, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Every now and then. As you follow the direction they're going, you're traveling much faster than they are. The hot air does feel a little uncomfortable against your cloud-based misty forms, but you do not feel like it's responsible for evaporating any of your form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're just sweating a little bit more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're like, "oh this is uncomfortable." You continue to press forward as the sun slowly begins to set. The temperature begins to get colder and colder, and the sky grows darker.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we condense a little bit? Turn into a low-lying fog? Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The form is your choice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could we turn into a marine layer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You continue to travel throughout the night?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How long does this thing last?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eight hours, right? It lasts eight hours?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll travel eight hours.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll take a late night. Once it wears off, then we'll camp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we get the whole way there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wind Walk, you said it was a day's journey, and we can travel faster by Wind Walking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At night, will we know where northeast is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I've got an excellent sense of direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If it's only a day's travel, at some point we're going to see the city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we should be able to get there, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we can camp just outside the city, maybe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Let's do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because we have a flying speed of 300 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a pretty amazing sight for those of you who have not been to such a large desert atmosphere, and it is pitch black below you, and at the height you're traveling-- How high are you traveling versus the ground? I guess I should ask.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 300 feet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: An appropriate cloud height.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's thousands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hundreds. A couple hundred feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Orange, yellows, greens, blues. It is a beautiful view. What is your plan?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we camp outside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we still clouds, though?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're still clouds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can't talk at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we mist down?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we getting to the end of our eight hours anyway?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's been five or six.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's still night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still night, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's good to camp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's two in the morning, at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does there look like any patch of shrubs or a low point in the terrain? Cover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't tell from this height, unfortunately.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We mist down a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You scoot down around the outside of the city walls. The landscape here near the town appears to be more packed and hardened badland dust and sand. You can see where lots of it, from a recent rain, have caked and hardened and then broken in places. It leaves this soft, shale-type texture to it that breaks into sand upon crumbling underfoot. From what you can see, there are a number of various heights of dunes in the distance. This city is thrown right in the center of what appears to be hundreds of miles of desert from the view that you had as the sun was setting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And the gates to the city are closed at night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gates to the city are closed from this perspective, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We did it, you guys. We made it to Burning Man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys timed this, I didn't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see guards around? Do they look aggressive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The giant iron gates stand about 65 feet tall and about as wide from end to end. They have a very tight weave of iron bars between them, to where it's almost a very thick fencing that you can almost see through. You can just see the outline of things that walk back and forth behind it. However, on the front side, you can see a number of guards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can see your piece of paper on the screen. Still see it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stop looking at my piece of paper on the screen!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a Vestige!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not actually. Not anymore, it's not! It's gone! All right. Amongst the carved-out circle of caravan carts and people that are camping overnight before entering the city, you do see what appear to be a dozen guards, all dressed in dark blue and dark reddish metallic armor, many carrying heavy scimitars to their side or long pikes and shields. They're all wearing intricate helmets that crest down past the nose to the point where it looks like they just have eyes and a lower jaw. It flares out at the bottom and then curves to a point right across where the clavicle would be. The armor itself is designed in a very beautiful ornate fashion, but also looks very functional. You're at a distance; they don't seem to have noticed you as you've all crested down still in your cloud forms.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably land far away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to de-mist. There seems to be a section where people are camping. Let's just, for once, take this by the book. We want to make sure they know we're here. No sneaking into the city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think they'd take kindly to surprises.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At worst, we've got the pretense of being emissaries from Emon looking for help.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They punish people for nicking things. I don't think we want to try to break in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. we're going to try and be truthful as much as possible, although nobody say the W word.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wine?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wine, definitely wine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm assuming that that's the Hand of Ord that we're looking at.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Hand of Ord is supposed to be super secret.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might just be guards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Hand of Ord isn't secret.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, he said the Hand of Ord is the name of the peacekeeping guards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, that's right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's camp for the evening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shall we camp in the mansion, then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So comfortable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're still a distance though? Where we are, from the guards?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. We're off a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How far are you guys? How far did you decide to stop and transform? That's up to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where were the other people camping for the night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're maybe 40 feet from the gates.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, let's camp 40 feet. Let's camp with them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want to put a magical door 40 feet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm perfectly okay. It's not like they can come in. No one can enter who can't be invited.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to make a mystical door floating in the middle of their tents?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do the people seem friendly? Do they seem tired?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to camp next to their campsite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In this world, on the ground? I love it. We haven't done it that much lately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've been too used to being careful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In the mansion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So not really camping. We're glamping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At a safe distance, you can make out some detail, and there is some lantern light on top of some of these carts. It appears that a number of the folks have set up small tents, and most appear to be sleeping. There are a few guards that are set on top of the carts with crossbows resting over their lap, keeping an eye in case anyone decides to get too close to their wares throughout the evening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about we keep a distance?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's not mist down in the middle of a group.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, let's keep a distance from them and be another group of people coming into the city.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd say 200 yards out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival said he already un-misted.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're deciding how far. So 200 yards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can re-mist.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We can all do that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As long as the eight hours hasn't passed, we can go in and out as you please, isn't that correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It takes you a minute to transform.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we use our misting while we have it and mist into the city?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I said, but they punish crime so harshly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We haven't committed any crime.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but they have to document who goes in and out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They won't even know--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scan-man, let's start by playing nice, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And if we get caught, they're going to know we didn't sign in correctly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They have giant spires, yeah, and they're going to say "who are you?" and we're not going to be on the list.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We know nothing about these people or the customs here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we've got to learn a little bit before we kill all of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't see any trees, and those guards look heavily funded. That looks like expensive armor they're all wearing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've got a good eye, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we have the mansion, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, yes, we can do the mansion.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Get close enough to the other group that they are aware that we exist, but they couldn't quite make us out, so just another group of travelers camping for the night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With a door floating in the air.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's magic. It's not like they've never seen it before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just have a seat and keep an eye bead on those of you that are visible. Doesn't appear to be any aggressive action, just an acknowledgement of your presence and a show of readiness should any aggressive action be taken.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to not say anything but do the "be pleased" motion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He already did that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I'm doing it, as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to watch you do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we've un-misted. Are we going to mansion and go to sleep?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's time to mansion and go to sleep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. We'll do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, the people who are camping, what do they look like? Pretty common folk, I'm assuming?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the gentlemen and ladies that are guarding the encampment are dressed in functional leathers with hints of hide and metal plates incorporated in the defense, but nothing that shows overt wealth or overt destitution. General mercenary guardians for a traveling caravan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Are we going to talk to any of them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Unless there's a brazenly loud group around one of the campfires.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this hour? No. You get the sense, looking at the surroundings of the campfires, it looks like some sort of party or gathering may have transpired earlier in the evening, but most everyone have passed out at this time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The guards are guarding. Anybody that approaches is a threat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we'll just go to sleep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Goodnight, all. I am ready for bed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will make the mansion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the distance, you see some of the guards step forward and keep an eye out there. Attention has been gained by the doorway, but none of them are approaching immediately. You guys begin to step into the doorway one by one as three of the guards begin to slowly walk towards the doorway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go last. It'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, why don't you hang with Percival? I go in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I stand in the doorway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We going to talk to these people?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to let them know who we are and what we're doing. This is just that we have a very expensive tent.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So with that, Percival, Scanlan, and Vex wait outside the shimmering doorway to Scanlan's magnificent mansion. You see the guards begin to approach. The one at the front, a square-jawed, intense-looking man who looks to be not enjoying his current time schedule as a guard on the outside of the southern gates of Ank'Harel approaches, hand at the side clutching some sort of weapon that he has currently sheathed. "May I ask the business of this strange conjuration "you've brought at this hour of the night?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is our very expensive tent.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Be pleased.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do. 23. Yeah, 24 actually. 24!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do not know of the nature of this magic that you bring, but I recommend that you keep it "outside of the city."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yes, of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, is magic not allowed within the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, magic is allowed, but this is unknown to us, and unknown magic is a dangerous magic."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thank you for your advice. We will heed it well. What is your name, sir?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It does not matter. We have 12 crossbows trained on this doorway, and will for the "remainder of the evening. Should anything strange happen, we will not hesitate but to fire."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The strangest thing you will see this evening will be us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you for the warning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Turns around and walks back to the gate.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That could not have gone better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Magic is allowed, but this is strange magic. How will we know what isn't strange magic?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Be prepared that not being from around here is going to be trouble.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I think we're just strange.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hold the door open.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've had old magic, new magic, strange magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is all the new schools of magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We go in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damaged kitchens are rearranged to have been not touched at all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wonderful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are able to rest for the evening as you prepare for your next day entering the city of Ank'Harel itself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I make my way, quietly in the night, to Grog's room. I was just kidding, sorry!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) I was like, "come get some, bitch!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I want to go to sleep, and I'm holding on to Fenthras and thinking about everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mulling over the events that recently transpired and digesting all the questions you still have.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I gave you a lot to think about, didn't I? Sorry. (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I play a card game by myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, everyone! Returning from the break, Vox Machina has an evening of rest in Scanlan's magnificent mansion. You come to consciousness the following morning, stationed within the beautiful confines of this magical mansion, unaware directly of what awaits you on the other side of the doorway. However, the morning is yours. What do you wish to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to stealth back to my room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No one sees anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No worries. I got a one, but I'll use luck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're using a luck?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two ones!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two ones!

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (yelling) Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is a god, and he hates you!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as the morning comes about, Vex, you go stretch out of your room, scratching the side of your head, messed up from sleeping wrong on the pillow, and as you walk out you hear (clicking) and look to your right and see your brother slowly slinking away from Keyleth's room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (retching) I go back in my room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh hey, hold on a second, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh man. (laughs) Talk it out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Talk it out right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm about to throw up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you make jokes, but I want to go into your room for a second and talk to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ew! Make him bathe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fine. And I go in my room and I sit down on the opposite side of the room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Take a full minute to get over it, you fucker.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold on, it's not been a minute. All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You really should have gone into acting. It really was your calling. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you doing? What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've never rolled two ones in a row.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that happened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that was so amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take that, Luck feat! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know this is a really stupid time to talk about it, but we never get to talk to each other, and I have a serious question. (nervous laugh) Relax. In that tree, that guy said a lot of fucked-up shit to you, and it just sounded like a lot of fucked-up shit and him trying to make you feel bad, so fuck him, right? Fuck that guy. But he said something about a dagger? And I saw your face fall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (soft laugh) Jesus Christ.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I asked you if you were all right the other day, and I think you might have not told me the entire truth. Are you all right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could be dead tomorrow, Vex. Right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He knew a lot of things, yes. I don't think he was completely wrong, and that's what makes me feel terrible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: About what, about you being shitty? Fuck that guy!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he was right about the dagger.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want you to tell me about the dagger. I want to know about the dagger, but I'm serious, fuck that guy on the rotten branches he was growing out of. He's not right. Your strength of character runs deep. Fuck that guy! It breaks my heart to see you doubt yourself. You have always been a wonderful woman! I'm not saying you have to be a fucking beefcake; you don't have to be a soldier, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All of them know that. They all know that. None of them doubt it. I don't doubt it. I don't have the words, I just want you to believe me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not eloquent like Percival, but I've known you a long time. You are a good person.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you. It makes me happy to see you happy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Forgot what it feels like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the dagger?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that. Yeah, I killed a couple people and I saved Trinket, that's all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket comes waking up from what was his sleeping stance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'll have to be more specific than that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you remember when I brought Trinket back to camp?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Originally?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! All those years ago?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes! I thought it was a terrible idea. I was dead wrong.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Well... turns out, I found him in a camp where I'd been taken.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, and there was some really dark people there, and they had harvested--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sneezes)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's mother. Bless you. Is Scanlan in the room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The paintings do all have holes cut in the eyes, so you can never be sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did what I had to do, and I killed them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The people that took you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. I did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The people that took you from me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. And I saved Trinket that night, and that's what Saundor saw. More than anything I just... I don't know how he saw it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you just creeped out because he knew or because of what happened? Why are you upset?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, listen. I wasn't there. I don't know what happened, but... you came back to me, so whatever happened can't be wrong.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right? (sniffles)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, come here! Come here! If somebody took you from me... I don't know how to see it any other way than I do. You would have to do something really terrible, Vex'ahlia, for me to ever feel disappointment in you, and you have not ringed that bell. Rung it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Rung it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You studied harder than I did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Goodness, please. One more time: You are a good person, and I've always seen that. Please see it, please. Oh god, my heart is breaking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! It's good. We all need to self-reflect every once in a while. I needed it. My heart is in the right place. I know it is. I'm just afraid sometimes actions speak louder than intentions. If things I was doing could be read the wrong way, then... maybe I need to change what I do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (sighs) You've always been bold. That's not a crime. That's all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's fine, dear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel like a boy again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) No, please. I'm so happy to see you happy. Don't worry about me. I'm fine!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, no, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I can talk to Trinket now. We talk all the time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vex'ahlia.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've talked through a lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes? (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck, I'm just going around-- I love you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Should you need me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Should you need me."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Sorry to babble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah, no. Maybe go take a shower.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not going to answer that. I'll see you at breakfast. And I walk away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't we change it up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm afraid not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Change up the food?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, maybe something other than chicken.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why? It's nutritious. It's delicious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ravioli!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ravioli for breakfast? All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Something with veggies?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do ravioli. Staff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, Scanlan?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, they speak?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit, they do talk!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could you make us some chicken ravioli?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You unlocked "Ravioli in Marquet!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're learning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're smart. We have to kill them all!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're going to learn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The servants vanish for about ten minutes and return with a robust meal of bowls and bowls of chicken ravioli.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Chicken ravioli. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Delicious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yummy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good call.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Adequate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Slightly. You finish your meal, feel yourself satiated as much as you can be with chicken ravioli for breakfast. You guys exit, find yourself on the exterior walls of Ank'Harel, the sun blazing down in the early morning, a hotter temperature than you've been used to in quite some time. Would be the equivalent of probably the low 100s Fahrenheit by our standards. All of you with layers of armor, which is all of you except for Grog, immediately feel this is going to be uncomfortable fairly quickly. Grog, you are used to higher colder climates, even without being heavily armored, still fairly uncomfortable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sucks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're really pale, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not great. You can see the caravans that you guys were camping loosely next to are no longer there. It looks like there have been a couple of dark spots in the dust and the sand that have been kicked over where the campsites were, where the fires were put out, and tracks of where the carts and wheels have been dragged to and through the gate. You can now see about ten guards that are all stationed at the front of that iron gate on this side of the Ank'Harel wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well? Should we go in and be traveling people and kill everyone that we see?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about you let me take the lead on this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about no?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's our angle? We are weary travelers from Tal'Dorei, seeking--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we were going into this one with honesty. Thought we agreed to that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seeking help?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're ambassadors from Emon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth, do you really want to be honest or is it a ploy? Do we want to be honest?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The ploy is to be honest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our normality is dishonesty, so technically we're switching it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the ploy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a radical shift.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're not honest, so let's try it for once.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's do it. We're from Emon, we need help fighting dragons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like that's pretty compelling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, make an intelligence check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Minus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find yourself instinctually nodding.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll just go in, big guy. We'll be fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're the first one in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm all in. Violence. That's what I came away with.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sighs) We have to be careful with our word choices with him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We head towards the gate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (garbled) This ravioli is delicious, by the way. My compliments to the little purple men.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're not men, but yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys approach the outside of the gate, you can see seven of the guards stay behind while three, seemingly the same three that had been keeping a close eye upon your initial approach in the evening, walk up. The same man walks up, now looking a little tired; his day is probably finishing out the rest of his station here at the gate. Approaches, hand still on the side of his sheathed weapon. "So you awaken. You have rested. What is your business here in "Ank'Harel?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are weary travelers from Emon, and we have come to seek assistance with the security of our home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What is your contact within the city? Who do you wish to speak to?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go for the top?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's a really far stretch. The king.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are seeking a man called...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: J'mon Sa Ord.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I don't think we want to talk to the king. Do we?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Merchant warrior? No, not that one? Who the fuck are we trying to see?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We would like to talk to J'mon Sa Ord or his or her advisors to seek advice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You come for an audience with the emperor?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We come for an audience with many people, to be honest. We are looking at many avenues of possible help. Contacts, trade, anything that can help us in our time of dire need.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me or him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Okay. It was a million.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't know that that die went that high.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a million.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have no business between either of those answers. If you wish to enter, do so, but keep "your weapons sheathed, and keep an eye on that one."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The big one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's well-behaved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't trust his face."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: His face is usually not the trouble.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it the beard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. Welcome to Ank'Harel. Be pleased."

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Be pleased.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He turns around and walks away. His bow is much smaller than you were originally taught by Jarett. You get the sense that that's more of a formality and is on a smaller scale for more informal conversations. As he walks back, he lifts one hand and does a loop with it. As he does, (door thudding). The gates open ever so slightly, enough to bring through as broad-shouldered an individual as Grog, as well as the rest of you easily. You guys walk up and approach.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is anybody looking at Trinket weird, or is it okay? He's with us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, no one seems to bat an eye at the large bear that's wandering inside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But they give a shit about the goliath? That's fucked up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One last question for our good friend at the gate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you walk past him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One more thing, good sir. If you were going to find a place to sleep comfortably, quietly, and without incident for the evening in the city, is there a place that you would recommend to a friend?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, best I can think, there are many fine establishments of rest where rooms can be rented "throughout the entirety of the city. Depending on how much coin you have to give, I would say you "could..." He thinks for a second as I look at my notes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where you would put a brother-in-law that you liked?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Medium to high.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would recommend within the Suncut Bazaar, you would find the Debt's Respite, the Shade, or "the Corner Cove. All very fine establishments, and very well watched by the Hand."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Hand?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you a member of the Hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am. Is this your first time in the city, then?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is absolutely, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was the name of the district?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Suncut Bazaar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Suncut Bazaar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he watches you guys enter, the gates closing behind you, you now see the incredible reveal of the interior of the mystical city itself. Streets of smooth cobblestone-like red pebbles lead your eyes to hundreds of visible, vertically-inclined buildings of reaching peaks and smooth, pointed rooftops as far as your eye can see across the cityscape. It's a city of vibrant color; you see nearly every home, storefront, and outhouse has some form of draping silks or painted mural to give it individual character, standing out against the rest of its neighboring abodes, creating a calming, beautiful symphony of really nothing, in the presentation of it all. The people are walking with purpose, and the sounds of foreign barking and shouts occasionally break the air. Welcome to Ank'Harel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get arrested right now!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you guys wish to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need spice. We need to find out about this merchant guy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got to get laid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's nothing that doesn't mean it's a pact.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to need to talk to some gentry. We're going to need to talk to a library.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we should probably start with a tavern.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I should also mention, not just a tavern is available, but we do in fact have three titled people within our crowd, so we can actually talk to people of standing and note with very little difficulty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we certain that that will hold any water on this continent?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It holds water on every continent. Only people who are not titled think it doesn't.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we split up into a couple parties? No? All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go to this bazaar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: People tend to know things in taverns.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Get the word out of what we're looking for.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To the Suncut Bazaar!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, what if there's a market, like an open farmer's market we could get some spice?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. As we look around, do we see any markets? Actually, the shopping district would be a wonderful place to look for--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that in the Suncut Bazaar, or could we head that direction while we look?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi! Oi, you there, boy! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance over, you see walking down the street what appears to be two teenage boys, huddled together, wearing drab, ankle-length cloth robes. One of them has a purple shawl over their shoulders. The other has a hood up, and they're both carrying small satchels of fruit in their arms. They both stop and turn. They look curiously at the small gnome, the small, pale gnome in foreign clothes and adorned, beautiful armor that walks up to them in the street.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That looks like fine fruit. Where would you go to go shopping for things here, market-y things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (muttered conversation) "You are a very small man."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sorry to hear that."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. My cross to bear. I've seen many medicine men about it, but they can't cure it, but many have recommended that I get a diet of vegetables and fruit. Where could I buy some, just like the kind that you have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This fruit is actually very difficult to find and come across. If you wish, you could "purchase this batch."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I've seen this before. I'm not interested in buying from you. I just want a market or a bazaar or anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bazaar. You are looking for the Suncut Bazaar?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is farther down that way. Look to the blue tower in the center of the city? Walk in its "direction to the eastern skyline--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not looking in the direction. I'm keeping my eyes on them the entire time he's talking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm desperately trying to commit every direction to memory.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am so fearful that he's about to try and buy meth from children.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Look for the strings of crimson flags that hang across the very street corners. That will "signify the entrance to the Suncut Bazaar."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're so helpful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. They both seem confused, but also strangely enamored with this tiny man who's talking to them. No shifty behavior beyond that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Their hands aren't moving into someone's pockets?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, spice? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Oh my god!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you spice?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you spice?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yo, you cool? You cool, dog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (muttered conversation) "I don't know what you're talking about."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not an authority. Do you spice? Spice it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am sorry. I'm confused?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's cool. Ignore that part. Thank you so much. What do you think, a little spice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He puts his hand out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I flip him a coin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes it. "Good luck finding your fruit."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And they both walk away, but at a slow pace, looking over their shoulder at you the whole way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They seemed legit! They seemed like they were street kids.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What about that was legit?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're riffraff. They could know what spice is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They were carrying fruit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They look normal, but I've got a keen eye for these things. I was a kid on the street for a long time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck. That was great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (deep sigh)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we go in the direction?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We walk towards the Suncut Bazaar, keeping an eye out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But your attention now, here in the Suncut Bazaar, as you step around the corner, you can see tents and storefronts and buildings and voices raised as different barkers are shouting out for their wares. You can see carts being drawn through the streets by horse and camel. You can see what appear to be dozens upon dozens of people coming through with small satchels and coming by and purchasing their necessities for the day. You can smell cooking meats and food in the distance. You can see street performers juggling, and distant music of buskers in the side of the street, playing various flutes and instruments: some you recognize, some you do not. You actually see a shawm. It catches your attention on the side of the street.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need a new reed for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And here you are, amongst the Suncut Bazaar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I whip around and see if anyone's following us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, Dust of Tracelessness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hammer down! 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. No matter where you walk, eyes are on you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am a gorgeous man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some sort of sales pitch they're giving, and there's a few people gathered around them. This is a very wide variety of people that live in this city, and everyone seems to mesh together without issue or prejudice, but not one goliath has caught your eye, and you've caught the eyes of many. And wherever you walk, you can see the townspeople stop, and they don't gawk. They don't stare intently. They're more curious, but no one appears to be following you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are the shops here indoors, or are they outdoor tent markets?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few that appear to go into buildings, but the majority of this, as you look at now the Suncut Bazaar itself, while it is a section of the city, it is mostly open sky and is probably hundreds of various tents, carts, pop-up stand-ups, and even the center of the street, blankets set out, with the various merchants there with their wares strewn across the ground, waiting for anybody to come and approach.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we see any spice merchants?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, while she's rolling, do we all see people eyeballing him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's pretty easy to see, and most everyone's--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In love? Enamored? Jealous?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. You look around and ask a few people, and most everyone shrugs their shoulders or points you in an odd direction, and no immediate spice merchants catch your attention. You're still on the outskirts of the Suncut.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do there appear to be any fruit merchants?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few, actually. Yeah. And it's interesting. In this very hot desert environment, and you understanding how most plant life exists, fruit should be pretty damn rare, and what fruit would make it here seems to be pretty dry and withered. But everything you come across here is very plump, beautiful, and fresh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Life.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Needs things to live.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's not many things, no. Can I go up to one of the fruit merchants?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go up to what appears to be a woman, probably in her late thirties. Her hair is long past her shoulders, and these dark black, brunette waves that spray out like mermaid hair across her shoulders. As you approach, she eagerly reaches out. "You look like you are traveling here to "Ank'Harel in search of beautiful, delicious fruits of which to whet your palate. Yes? Would you like for "these fine apples, of which are the finest you could find?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Apples? Oh wow. I was looking for something a little bit more exotic. Something native to this land.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What you'd prefer, then, would be the kurrak "fruit." And she pulls out what looks like a mango, but the exterior of it is very rough, with these little spines all around it. "While it is difficult to hold, crack open for a delightful "flavor. It is gentle. It is like a sweet water experience."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was very descriptive. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much do I owe you for this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For this, that would be two silver pieces."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two silver. And how much, just for future reference, are the apples?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The apples would go for one silver piece apiece."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't worry about it. Here you go. I give her a little extra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you would like?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I'm good, thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I peek around her shoulder. Where would the Shade be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Shade? The Shade would be-- it's hard to explain. Do you see that building over there "with the dark green steeple?" And you glance off in the distance. You can see, layers back, there appears to be one spire, this very harsh point that has a dark green tint. "That is the roof of "the Shade. That'd be what you're looking for."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not a problem."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to walk by, and as I'm passing Vex, I'm going to do that thing where you walk past a friend and you do that sideways kick in the butt, and I'm going to go stand by Grog, and anybody I see giving him the evil eye, I'm going to match it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You watch as she walks away, she had her hands out to Vex, and as soon as Vex keeps walking away, she goes--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I toss her a gold. She's with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are free to shop here any day you like."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And what was your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She pulls the coin out and pops it away and says, "I am Shubad."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shubad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Shubad."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A pleasure to meet you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A pleasure. Thank you so much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are any of the barkers talking about magic stuff?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also looking for a soothsayer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you want to see, a show?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I don't know. It just seems so exotic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything out of the ordinary and/or a soothsayer, card-reader, bones-reader, whatever they have that's like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Both of you make investigation checks as you look around and ask around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I don't like the way these folks are looking at big man, so I'm going to stay by him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You stay close to Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No going up from that. That's what it is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that true?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am city-blind, apparently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you looking for?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm looking for anything out of the ordinary, but specifically, a soothsayer, a card-reader, a bones-thrower.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog. Glancing about, you look to see something shine across the ground. As you rush up and find it, you find what looks to be a magically enchanted stone about that big. Rough around the edges, but the reddish color is brighter red than the rest of the stones on the ground, and you're sure that this may be exactly what you were looking for.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm watching him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I quickly get on my hands and knees, and I start moving the sand around, looking for one just like it, just to make sure it's unique.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are many red stones around it, as you press the bit of dust and sand gathered around the other cobblestones, but this one appears to be unique.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! What does it taste like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a hit of saltiness to the dust that has gathered in this vicinity.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I gave away my salt-lick rock!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take a moment to marvel at how a being of such ferocity and power can be such a doofus at the same time. It's amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to plant myself at the end of two rows of the intersection and wait for people to walk by. And as they do, I say: Spice? Spice, spice, spice? You spice it? Spice, spice, spice?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I have seen Percy looking around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I help him look?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percival, what did you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where did it go? Investigation? I rolled a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's funny. For all the preparation of being a noble and public speaking, you are utterly lost.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'm terrible in urban areas. I've learned this. I get flustered.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The culture is so vastly different from what you're used to, and the people don't seem to really pay much mind to your relatively important outfit and presence, and you're lost at sea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never rolled a decent investigation check. It has never happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex walks up to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you looking for, dear?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Beyond anything interesting. Everything is too interesting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's very colorful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A soothsayer of some kind, perhaps. It might be a good way to start getting the word out of the sorts of things we're looking for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What sorts of things?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're looking for a cloak. We're looking for a merchant with one eye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I found a rock!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we're looking for rocks-- not anymore, I suppose. And those are usually the most trustworthy of the untrustworthy people you find in a city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Investigation? 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. The two of you begin to meander around, look around. You see, after some wandering, what looks to be a single blanket set out with a small half-dome shade structure of various cotton cloths that have been layered and pinned to create this loose escape from the sunlight. And you see what appears to be an older man with a very long braided beard that goes past his belly-button. He sits there, sleeveless open shirt, baggy pants, no shoes, and before him a deck of cards that is laying in a stack, and he has his eyes closed with his hands resting at the ends of his knees.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It sounds like fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Want to walk up? Yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You mind blowing a little bit of money on this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we all there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Depends on if you guys want to follow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd like to follow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. as you guys are approaching, you over in the corner.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spice it? Spice it? Fusaka!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A billion. Deception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Deception, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This marks your ability to double-talk or subtly put out the vibes for an individual.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why aren't you a crime kingpin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who knows what Scanlan's ultimate destiny is?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After a few moments of you doing this and a few people walking away, looking frustrated and taken aback, partially by your visual form and the unexpected contents of your words, one man in his early twenties walking up, what looks to be a damp cloth wrapped loosely around the head to keep the head cooled under the sun's heat, walks up and leans in and goes, "You're asking about spice, yes?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, hard-to-find spice. I don't know if they have it in this particular bazaar. It takes a seller with a keen eye to identify it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I know folks who are purveyors of many spices here. Please, what do you seek?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not really something that I want to discuss out in the open, but we could take a walk and talk about it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good, good. Lead on. We'll have a conversation as we go." As he stands back up after leaning down for you, you get a little glance at what appears to be a slightly pointed ear and what looks like a hint of a mustache that's grown through. Very similar in visual presentation as to your comrades: not full elf, not full human, though definitely a much darker shade due to the out-in-the-open lifestyle of Ank'Harel. You begin to walk with this figure through the street. We'll get to you in just a moment. So as you guys make your way to the older gentleman sitting on the ground, eyes closed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We sit down in front of him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His eyes are still closed.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Be pleased.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be pleased." His eyes open, and you can see his eyes are snow-blind. They are clouded over with what would probably be terrible cataracts or something else that has caused him full blindness, but he stares past you as he opens his eyes. "So you wish to be read, then?"

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Five gold for my services."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) He won't know what you put in his hand!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're not there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He will know. He's a fortune teller, for Christ's sake.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Five plumbing washers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I put five or 15, for each of us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five, for the moment. He knows there's three of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He places it into a small side pouch. "What do you wish to be read for?" He takes the cards and begins shuffling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We search for a garment. We search for a man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's this weird boy with a crystal in Labyrinth, but with a card deck. It's wild. As he stays still, looking past all of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we search for answers towards the future that we inevitably run to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You search for a garment." And he takes two cards out and throws them across the center of the blanket for you guys. You guys step back and take a look. One of them appears to have a fire or a camp flame with smoke pouring up out of it, and the other one appears to have a storm, a torrent of water, and he goes, "This garment you seek. It "looks to be in motion, moving. If you seek this garment here, may haste take you. Your second "question." What were you saying in the second one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We search for a man.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With one eye.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I didn't say that far.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A merchant warrior. Missing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He doesn't need that. He's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you say?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, we search for a man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pulls up two more cards and throws them, and they land almost exactly in the same place as the other two cards that he tossed before. They scoot to a stop. One card appears to be mostly blank, except it carries some sort of a stylized symbol or letter that you don't recognize. And the other one appears to be a hand of cards stuffed within a pile of coin. "You seek this man, yet it is not a "man you seek. To where the luck brings you, the answers lie." And he puts out his hand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And the third question?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I insight check him as he's reading the cards? See if his face twitches at all, if it looks like he's making shit up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the whispers! So many whispers. How are the Cowboys doing, Travis?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I stopped looking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can tell you how they're doing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sounds like a sad man right there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, let's consult the cards. That's the third question.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's pre-season. Nobody playing right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah, sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The cards say the Cowboys are not--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, maybe you and me should go to a game sometime.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would love to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. And the third question?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We move towards a conflict. What should we know? What should we be prepared for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pulls the two cards forward, throws them down, landing once again almost precisely on the same space as the last two tosses. They slide to a stop. One of them shows a chasm cracking in the earth, and the other appears to show a singular, sunken skull. "The path is to change historic, but "many will fall as the transition is to take. Take your time wisely, for the hourglass runs "quickly."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Goddamn it. Five more gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is this all of your questions?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That will do, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then be pleased." And he takes the cards and shuffles them back into the deck, rights them into a perfect square with one quick move of his hand, and places them back in front, puts his hands back on his knees, and closes his eyes and puts his head down. There's a pause, and he reaches over and grabs a small, partially eaten apple and (chomp).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I as quietly as possible put another five gold in front of him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Puts it into a pocket. "You ask for one more question. What do you inquire?" (card shuffling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I make the right choice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them shows upon it two hands joining, and the other one shows a symbol of a sun rising over a mountain range. He says, "You've made many "choices, but the one you speak of brings unity and a new dawn."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Be pleased.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He nods. "Be pleased." Takes the cards up, shuffles them back into the deck, and sets it down. He goes back into his meditative trance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel that was money well spent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was so cool!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we know we do not necessarily look for a man, which is important. We know that time is even more of the essence than we first implied, and considering that almost every soothsayer I've ever met is as crooked as the day is long, the word is now out that we're looking for them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's the Shade. Should we head that direction?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to bring your rock?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should grab Scanlan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan is gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We need one of those leashes for him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shorthalt?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's maintain a certain level of plausible deniability.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No biggie. Just checking in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're walking with your half-elvish friend down one of the nearby alleyways, you hear Keyleth speaking over the earring.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I say: I'm cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to die. Let's get a room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys make your way towards the Shade?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Scanlan, we're heading towards the Shade. It's the big green tent. Follow?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (clicks tongue) Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your half-elven compadre goes, "Are you all right?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm cool. I'm cool on these desert nights, and I need something to warm me up at night, so that's why I was inquiring about this spice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please, which spice are you seeking?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It might not be entirely legal, but fusaka?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He nods. "It may take a bit of time. I know someone who could bring this, but I could not "bring you to them. They'd have to bring it to you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where can we meet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, where are you staying?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm staying outside of the walls in a small encampment, but I can meet him sometime tonight inside the walls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Where would you need to meet?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about where we first met, at that same intersection, or is that too busy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is far too busy. It needs to be private, away."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sort of a visitor here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you want a place to stay, there is Luck's Run, the casino. There are back rooms there."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a casino?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hells yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is the Debt's Respite Inn, which has its own grasp of lowlifes. Those are probably the "best bets."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's meet in a room at the casino.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The casino it is. Which room?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The red room? I'm not familiar with this casino. I'll need some guidance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wear a red shirt. He will find you in the casino."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. That sounds good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Hour past sundown, we'll find you there."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tonight? What time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "An hour past sundown."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How much do you want?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god. I'm not prepared for this!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He starts looking a little untrusting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be cool, man. Be cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to go on a bender.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A billion. More than before. 35.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How are you rolling that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gives you a look and bends down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've had a rough few weeks, and I need to get away from it all and go to that place--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gets close to your face, interrupts you, and goes, "I mean this with all due respect: "Being as small a man as you are, you have to be careful."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The amount you ask, I have no specific amount. I'd "have to inquire, but I would say, to be safe, bring about 200 gold pieces with you. Just in case."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It'll be pure, not cut with anything else? I want the good stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks at you, confused.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I buying cinnamon here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Might be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be a living baby.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's going to be a pound of turmeric!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cardamom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. We have a deal. Let's shake on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He reaches out and takes your hand, and you shake. "Very well. Hour after sundown. Casino." He brings his cloth up and brings it up over his face for a second and darts into one of the nearby corners and vanishes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where did you guys go? Hello?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're at the Shade!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay! I'm coming! Where is that? Shit, where am I? I ask around for the Shade.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You eventually find it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, stop panicking. I can hear you hyperventilating.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, I've just never done anything that cool before!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And you still haven't.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The hell you haven't!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just did a drug deal, guys!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, not over the speakers! Not over the phone line!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have drugs with you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! I'll tell you later!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: These earrings are tapped. You know that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They could be listening! I'm coming to you!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like there are beaded curtains and various draperies that separate each of the different rooms, and there's large, hookah-type tobacco pipes. It's very much just a relaxing lounge area.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's hookah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's hookah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never tried hookah before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You've never tried hookah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Earth Ashari are super into the hookah. It's really nice, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the only thing I actually know about this continent, is that there's tobacco.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We should try it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did Scanlan get here yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan takes about five minutes or so, but eventually catches up to you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we staying here? It's not very private.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not very private, and privacy is definitely higher on the list.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I find a patron that seems chill?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You look around. You can see what looks to be a matronly older woman wearing some nicer dark purple and black clothing, who is sitting there with one big hookah next to her side, by herself, with a glass of wine to one of the sides, and is staring into space.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And only you and you know how funny that is, because it's sealed in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk up. Be pleased.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Be pleased. Can I help you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually, just a small trifle. Are you staying here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Over the next few hours, yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lovely. We're from out of town--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You don't say."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, and I've noticed the Shade is rather open. Do you know if the Corner Cove or Debt's Respite are quite as private as this, or do they have actual rooms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Both of those have rooms, yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Lovely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you have any other specifics or requirements?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they far from here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Corner Cove is maybe two miles that way, but the Debt's Respite is about a mile that way."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you. Sorry to bother you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should we put some cards on the table?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some cards?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought that's what we just did with that other guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've been searching for a friend of ours, and it's been very complicated. She's got one eye. She's been around for quite a while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's a merchant in town. We've been looking for her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are many merchants that live here."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are there many merchants with one eye?

lines.name: LAURA
